DOC.brief_summary: The study ass analgesic efficacy safety tolerability single oral dose SAF312 postoperative dental pain patient 3rd molar extraction .
DOC.brief_title: To Evaluate Safety , Tolerability Analgesic Efficacy SAF312 Postoperative Dental Pain Patients
DOC.criteria: Extraction two impact ( partial full ) third molar . At least one impaction low jaw . Each patient evaluate her/his postsurgical pain intensity prior take trial medication . To eligible trial , post surgical pain must moderate severe Subjects good health otherwise determine past medical history , physical examination , vital sign , electrocardiogram laboratory test screen . Female subject either postmenopausal surgical sterilization . Patients know hypersensitivity diclofenac , aspirin , acetaminophen antipyretic allergy manifest attack asthma , urticaria acute rhinitis follow treatment aspirin agent cyclooxygenaseinhibiting activity NSAIDs . Use antipyretic/analgesic drug 48 hr predose 24 hr postdose Presence bleeding disorder ( history excessive bleeding dental procedure minor injury ) Patients Diabetes mellitus . Presence , history , family history malignant hyperthermia anesthesiarelated event may suggestive malignant hyperthermia . An abnormal ECG screening , include PR > 200 m , QRS > 110 m , QTcF < 380 > 450 m , lead II T wave abnormality . Nonspecific T wave abnormality lead lead II permissible accompany morphological abnormality . Patients infection e.g . dental abscess Other protocoldefined inclusion/exclusion criterion may apply
